@brocktron1 Yup! If anyone follows the Instructions precisely it will never fail! I am still using it and no issue at all. The key for this is to block NERO from accessing the Internet even before you enter in it the serial. So just before it asks you to enter the serial block it from accessing the Internet. This way your serial will never get "Blackkisted".

||-WINDOWS SP3 IS THE MINIMUM REQUIRED FOR INSTALL!!!-||
I skipped that part, and now i can't install. And I don't want SP3 ... Other then that the DL speed was pretty quick and didn't pick up any virus alerts... If this was SP2 compatible I'd be on it like white on rice in a glass of milk on a paper plate.

As expected this doesn't work. Drop an AVI into NeroVison and you'll get a "Patent Activation" error after the Trial serial has expired. Same as every other Nero 10.5 release.

A special activation serial is needed in addition to the regular serial, and there hasn't been a working one since v.10.0.13100. And those keys are blacklisted in the newer versions. The KeyGen that is floating around is useless.
